description:
Carolina’s vibrant people and programs attest to the University’s long-standing place among leaders in higher education since it was chartered in 1789 and opened its doors for students in 1795 as the nation’s first public university. Situated in the beautiful college town of Chapel Hill, N.C., UNC has earned a reputation as one of the best universities in the world. Carolina prides itself on a strong, diverse student body, academic opportunities not found anywhere else, and a value unmatched by any public university in the nation.

UNC-Chapel Hill's LinkedIn comments guidelines:

Thank you for liking the LinkedIn page of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. This page highlights information about the people and programs at Carolina. Consistent with UNC-Chapel Hill’s Policy on Prohibited Discrimination, Harassment and Related Misconduct, and the North Carolina Campus Free Speech Act, we encourage your comments and opinions as they relate to our posts.

This page is actively monitored for relevance. Carolina reserves the right to remove any comments that are not related to the particular post, make unsupported accusations, contain ad-hominem attacks, use obscene language or images, are blatant spam, contain advertisements, or contain inappropriate personal information or sensitive information. Repeated violation of these guidelines or behavior that substantially disrupts the maintenance of this page could result in a user being blocked from the page. Thanks for keeping the page enjoyable for everyone. Go Tar Heels!

updates.text:
Did you catch our new TV spot during the game this evening?

When Tar Heels arrive at #UNC, they meet a world of possibilities. Pursue musical passions. Conduct important research. Compete for championships. No matter your background or interests, you have the opportunity to make your mark at Carolina. 

We’re all part of the same Tar Heel team, and everyone has a role to play. How do you imagine your Heelprint? ⬇️

On Nov. 8, Tar Heels eagerly gathered to celebrate the grand opening of Meantime at the Junction, the second location of the student-run coffee shop in partnership with Innovate Carolina.

Meantime’s second location expands its mission while remaining deeply rooted in Chapel Hill, showcasing its commitment to sustainability, social entrepreneurship and the #UNC community.

Learn more about the new space https://unc.live/4fKFZHZ

Award-winning assistant professor Gary Kayye💜 CTS found his passion for storytelling 47 years ago when he saw the first "Star Wars" movie. 

Kayye has taught advertising at #UNC since 2009, inspiring students through MEJO 477: New Media Technologies—a course blending creativity, technology. This year, he received a Chancellor's Award—selected by students—demonstrating the degree to which his teaching resonates.

Learn more about Kayye's passionate force of storytelling https://unc.live/3AJ5Z7N

Former CNN correspondent Leyla Santiago mentors students at UNC Hussman School of Journalism and Media, teaching courses that produce the “Carolina Week” newscast and two live shows, "Rise and Shine" and "Carolina Ahora." 

In her classes, #UNC students handle all aspects of broadcast production, with industry experts providing valuable feedback and guidance.

Learn how Santiago helps Hussman students learn skills from professionals https://unc.live/40HHG4D

This semester, #UNC senior Jessica Bowling put her studies on pause, spending the month of October in the mountains with the Army National Guard to help with Hurricane Helene relief. 

Her work involved post-event canvassing and managing the influx of donations, and after returning to classes on Nov. 4, Bowling credited her Carolina professors for a smooth transition and stronger connections.

Learn about Bowling’s commitment to public service https://unc.live/3CoWVpb

How well do you know #UNC's campus? Can you guess where this photo was taken? 🐏 

Let us know down below ⬇️ 

Option 1 - Tarrson Hall
Option 2 - Houpt Building
Option 3 - Koury Oral Health Sciences Building
Option 4 - Thurston-Bowles Building
